content: Former election constituency of SingaporeThis article **needs additional citations for verification**. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Southern Islands Constituency" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(January 2022)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* **Southern Islands Constituency** was a constituency in Singapore. It existed from 1955 to 1968 and included [Sentosa](/wiki/Sentosa), [Pulau Brani](/wiki/Pulau_Brani), [Kusu Island](/wiki/Kusu_Island) and [St John's Island](/wiki/St_John%27s_Island). ## Member of Parliament ElectionMember of ParliamentParty**1955**[Mohamed Sidik bin Abdul Hamid](/wiki/Inche_Sidik)[MU](/wiki/Malay_Union)**1959**Ahmad Jabri bin Mohammed Akib[PKMS](/wiki/Pertubuhan_Kebangsaan_Melayu_Singapura)**1963**Ya'acob bin Mohammed[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) ## Electoral results Note: The [Elections Department](/wiki/Elections_Department_Singapore) does not include rejected votes when calculating the vote shares of candidates. Hence, all candidates' vote shares will total to 100% at any given election (may not appear so in multi-way contests due to rounding). ### Elections in 1950s [General Election 1955](/wiki/1955_Singaporean_general_election): Southern Islands PartyCandidateVotes%±%[Malay Union](/wiki/Malay_Union)Mohamed Sidek bin Abdul Hamid1,23350.6[PP](/wiki/Progressive_Party_(Singapore))Hollupatherage James Caldera Kulasingha1,20549.4[Majority](/wiki/Majority#Related_terms)281.2[Turnout](/wiki/Voter_turnout)2,47669.8[Registered electors](/wiki/Voter_registration)3,548[Malay Union](/wiki/Malay_Union) **win** (new seat)[General Election 1959](/wiki/1959_Singaporean_general_election): Southern Islands PartyCandidateVotes%±%[UMNO](/wiki/UMNO)Ahmad Jabri bin Mohammad Akib2,59853.7[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)Kum Teng Hock1,22525.3[LSP](/wiki/Liberal_Socialist_Party_(Singapore))Mohammed Ismail bin Haji Mohammed Hussain1,01220.9 28.5[Majority](/wiki/Majority#Related_terms)1,37328.4 27.2[Turnout](/wiki/Voter_turnout)4,87991.6 21.8[Registered electors](/wiki/Voter_registration)5,325 50.1[UMNO](/wiki/UMNO) **gain** from [Malay Union](/wiki/Malay_Union)[Swing](/wiki/Swing_(politics)) 52.2 ### Elections in the 1960s [General Election 1963](/wiki/1963_Singaporean_general_election): Southern Islands PartyCandidateVotes%±%[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)Ya'acob bin Mohamed2,76455.4 30.1[Singapore Alliance Party](/wiki/Singapore_Alliance_Party)Ahmad Jabri bin Mohammad Akib2,22444.6 9.1[Majority](/wiki/Majority#Related_terms)54010.8 17.6[Turnout](/wiki/Voter_turnout)5,04896.4 4.8[Registered electors](/wiki/Voter_registration)5,236 1.7[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) **gain** from [Singapore Alliance Party](/wiki/Singapore_Alliance_Party)[Swing](/wiki/Swing_(politics)) 19.6 Note: PKMS became part of the Singapore Alliance (SA) before the 1963 general election. ## Historical maps This [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) location article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Southern Islands Constituency
